name: NOTION__GET_PAGE
description: Retrieves a Page object using the ID specified. Returns page properties (limited to 25 references per property) but not page content. For page content, use the Retrieve block children endpoint. For properties with >25 references, use the Retrieve a page property endpoint. If page's parent is a database, properties conform to database schema. If not, only title is available.

page_id.description: The ID of the page to retrieve.

filter_properties.description: A list of page property value IDs associated with the page. Use this param to limit the response to a specific page property value or values. To retrieve multiple properties, specify each page property ID. For example: ?filter_properties=iAk8&filter_properties=b7dh.

Notion-Version.description: The version of the Notion API to use. Defaults to 2022-06-28.

name: NOTION__SEARCH_PAGES
description: Searches all pages that have been shared with an integration. Returns pages that have titles matching the query.

Notion-Version.description: The version of the Notion API to use. Defaults to 2022-06-28.

query.description: The text to search for in page titles.

start_cursor.description: Cursor for pagination. If supplied, limits results to those after the cursor.

page_size.description: Number of results to return. Maximum: 100

name: NOTION__TOGGLE_PAGE_ARCHIVE
description: Archives or restores a page. Note: Cannot archive workspace-level pages via API, and the API does not support permanently deleting pages.

page_id.description: The ID of the page to archive or restore

Notion-Version.description: The version of the Notion API to use. Defaults to 2022-06-28.

archived.description: Set to true to archive the page, false to restore it from trash

name: NOTION__RESTORE_PAGE
description: Restores a page from trash.

page_id.description: The ID of the page to restore from trash

Notion-Version.description: The version of the Notion API to use. Defaults to 2022-06-28.

archived.description: Set to false to restore the page from trash

name: NOTION__LIST_USERS
description: Returns a paginated list of Users for the workspace. Does not include guests. Requires user information capabilities.

start_cursor.description: If supplied, this endpoint will return a page of results starting after the cursor provided. If not supplied, this endpoint will return the first page of results.

page_size.description: The number of items from the full list desired in the response. Maximum: 100

Notion-Version.description: The version of the Notion API to use. Defaults to 2022-06-28.

name: NOTION__GET_USER
description: Retrieves a User using the ID specified. Requires user information capabilities.

Notion-Version.description: The version of the Notion API to use. Defaults to 2022-06-28.

name: NOTION__GET_ME
description: Retrieves the bot User associated with the API token provided in the authorization header.

Notion-Version.description: The version of the Notion API to use. Defaults to 2022-06-28.

name: NOTION__CREATE_PAGE
description: Creates a new page that is a child of an existing page or database. If the parent is a database, properties must match the parent database's schema.

Notion-Version.description: The version of the Notion API to use.

parent.description: The parent page or database where the new page will be created. Use EITHER database_id OR page_id, not both.

database_id.description: The ID of the database this page belongs to (for database entries)

page_id.description: The ID of the page this page belongs to (for child pages)

properties.description: Page properties. For child pages, typically only 'title' is needed. For database entries, properties must match the database schema. Title format: {'title': [{'type': 'text', 'text': {'content': 'Page Title'}}]}

title.description: Page title as rich text array. Format: [{'type': 'text', 'text': {'content': 'Title Text'}}]

children.description: Page content as an array of block objects. Common types: paragraph, heading_1, heading_2, heading_3, bulleted_list_item, numbered_list_item

paragraph.description: Paragraph block content. Use when type is 'paragraph'

external.description: External file details when type is 'external'

name: NOTION__UPDATE_PAGE
description: Updates the properties of a page. Only the properties specified in the request are updated. Properties not specified are left unchanged.

page_id.description: The ID of the page to update

Notion-Version.description: The version of the Notion API to use.

properties.description: Page properties to update. For database pages, properties must match the database schema. For regular pages, typically only title can be updated. Title format: {'title': [{'type': 'text', 'text': {'content': 'New Title'}}]}

title.description: Page title as rich text array. Format: [{'type': 'text', 'text': {'content': 'Title Text'}}]

external.description: External file details when type is 'external'

name: NOTION__LIST_DATABASES
description: Returns a paginated list of Database objects retrieved from the integration's bot user. Does not support filtering databases.

start_cursor.description: If supplied, this endpoint will return a page of results starting after the cursor provided.

page_size.description: The number of items from the full list desired in the response. Maximum: 100

Notion-Version.description: The version of the Notion API to use. Defaults to 2022-06-28.

name: NOTION__GET_DATABASE
description: Retrieves a Database object using the ID specified. Returns the database schema and metadata.

database_id.description: The ID of the database to retrieve

Notion-Version.description: The version of the Notion API to use. Defaults to 2022-06-28.

name: NOTION__QUERY_DATABASE
description: Gets a list of Pages contained in the database, filtered and ordered according to the filter conditions and sort criteria provided in the request.

database_id.description: The ID of the database to query

Notion-Version.description: The version of the Notion API to use. Defaults to 2022-06-28.

filter.description: Filter conditions for database entries. When the filter conditions are not satisfied, the function still returns the empty result instead of an error.

property.description: The name of the property to filter by

contains.description: Text that the property should contain

equals.description: Boolean value the checkbox should equal

property.description: The name of the property to sort by

start_cursor.description: Cursor for pagination. If supplied, limits results to those after the cursor.

page_size.description: Number of results to return. Maximum: 100

name: NOTION__UPDATE_DATABASE
description: Updates the properties of a database. Only the properties specified in the request are updated.

database_id.description: The ID of the database to update

Notion-Version.description: The version of the Notion API to use.

title.description: Database title as rich text array. Format: [{'type': 'text', 'text': {'content': 'New Database Title'}}]

description.description: Database description as rich text array

name: NOTION__GET_BLOCK_CHILDREN
description: Returns a paginated array of child Block objects contained in the block using the ID specified. For pages, returns the first-level blocks within the page.

block_id.description: The ID of the block or page to get children from

page_size.description: Number of blocks to return. Maximum: 100

Notion-Version.description: The version of the Notion API to use.

name: NOTION__APPEND_BLOCK_CHILDREN
description: Creates and appends new children blocks to the parent block_id specified. Returns the Block objects for the created children.

block_id.description: The ID of the block or page to append children to

Notion-Version.description: The version of the Notion API to use.

children.description: Array of block objects to append. Common types: paragraph, heading_1, heading_2, heading_3, bulleted_list_item, numbered_list_item

paragraph.description: Paragraph block content. Use when type is 'paragraph'

heading_1.description: Heading 1 block content. Use when type is 'heading_1'

name: NOTION__GET_BLOCK
description: Retrieves a Block object using the ID specified. Returns the block content and metadata.

block_id.description: The ID of the block to retrieve

Notion-Version.description: The version of the Notion API to use.

name: NOTION__DELETE_BLOCK
description: Sets a Block object, including page blocks, to archived: true using the ID specified. Note: This does not delete the block permanently.

block_id.description: The ID of the block to delete (archive)

Notion-Version.description: The version of the Notion API to use.

name: NOTION__UPDATE_BLOCK
description: Updates a specific block's content and properties using the block ID. Supports updating text content, styling, and block-specific properties.

block_id.description: The ID of the block to update

Notion-Version.description: The version of the Notion API to use.

name: NOTION__CREATE_DATABASE
description: Creates a new database in a specified parent page with customizable properties, schema, and configuration for structured data management.

Notion-Version.description: The version of the Notion API to use.

parent.description: Parent page where database will be created

title.description: Database title as rich text array

name: NOTION__GET_PAGE_PROPERTY
description: Retrieves a property_item object for a given page_id and property_id. Useful for getting full data when a property has more than 25 references.

property_id.description: The ID of the property to retrieve

page_size.description: Number of items to return. Maximum: 100

Notion-Version.description: The version of the Notion API to use.

name: NOTION__LIST_COMMENTS
description: Retrieves all comments for a specific page or block, enabling collaborative feedback and discussion management.

block_id.description: The ID of the block to get comments for

page_size.description: Number of comments to return. Maximum: 100

Notion-Version.description: The version of the Notion API to use.

name: NOTION__CREATE_COMMENT
description: Creates a new comment on a specific page or block for collaborative feedback and discussion tracking.

Notion-Version.description: The version of the Notion API to use.

parent.description: Parent page or block to comment on

page_id.description: ID of the page to comment on

rich_text.description: Comment text as rich text array

name: NOTION__DUPLICATE_PAGE
description: Creates a duplicate of an existing page with all its content and properties, useful for templates and content replication.

page_id.description: The ID of the page to duplicate

Notion-Version.description: The version of the Notion API to use.

parent.description: Optional parent location for the duplicate

name: NOTION__EXPORT_PAGE
description: Exports a Notion page to various formats including PDF, HTML, and Markdown for documentation and sharing purposes.

page_id.description: The ID of the page to export

Notion-Version.description: The version of the Notion API to use.

name: NOTION__BULK_UPDATE_PAGES
description: Updates multiple pages in a database with batch operations for efficient bulk data management and automation workflows.

database_id.description: The ID of the database containing pages to update

Notion-Version.description: The version of the Notion API to use.

name: NOTION__GET_WORKSPACE
description: Retrieves workspace information including settings, members, and configuration for workspace administration and management.

Notion-Version.description: The version of the Notion API to use.

name: NOTION__LIST_PAGE_VERSIONS
description: Retrieves version history for a specific page, enabling content tracking, auditing, and rollback capabilities for collaborative workflows.

page_id.description: The ID of the page to get version history for

page_size.description: Number of versions to return. Maximum: 100

Notion-Version.description: The version of the Notion API to use.

name: NOTION__CREATE_TEMPLATE
description: Creates a reusable template from an existing page for standardized content creation and workflow automation across teams.

Notion-Version.description: The version of the Notion API to use.

source_page_id.description: ID of the page to use as template source

name: NOTION__LIST_TEMPLATES
description: Retrieves all available templates in the workspace for content creation, standardization, and workflow automation.

page_size.description: Number of templates to return. Maximum: 100

Notion-Version.description: The version of the Notion API to use.

name: NOTION__MOVE_PAGE
description: Moves a page to a different parent location within the workspace for better organization and content restructuring.

page_id.description: The ID of the page to move

Notion-Version.description: The version of the Notion API to use.

page_id.description: ID of the new parent page

database_id.description: ID of the new parent database

name: NOTION__GET_DATABASE_ANALYTICS
description: Retrieves analytics and usage statistics for a database including view counts, edit frequency, and user engagement metrics for performance monitoring.

database_id.description: The ID of the database to get analytics for

Notion-Version.description: The version of the Notion API to use.

name: NOTION__SHARE_PAGE
description: Creates a public sharing link for a page or configures private sharing with specific users for collaboration and external access management.

page_id.description: The ID of the page to share

Notion-Version.description: The version of the Notion API to use.

share_with_users.description: Array of user IDs to share with
